CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, June 6, 1942, page 1 reads: " When the naval recruiting office threw its doors open Monday to Negroes for the first time in a decade, Robert Frye, Pittsburgh Courier engraver, was the first recruit in line. He was accepted after a thorough examination and will leave soon for a naval training center. Seated beside Frye is Alfred W. Landucci (Left), yeoman second class U.S. Naval Reserve and Ensign Marshall B. Smith. Standing at the left is Lieut. Elmer B. Keckler, and at the right, Robert M.. McChesney, storekeeper first class, Naval Reserve. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert Frye standing in center with raised hand, Ensign Marshal Smith wearing military uniform on left, and Lieut. Elmer Keckler on right, gathered in interior with recruitment posters that read "Naval Aviation..." and "Man the Guns, Join the Navy"
